website_summaries.verdict: The model 45-0218 is a good pick for small to medium yards and limited budgets – has all the standard features in a push-behind model for an unbeatable price.
pros: Lightweight, easy to push, and simple to hang up for storage
Spacious for a push-behind model – offers 7 cubic ft. capacity
cons: Bag requires emptying more frequently than tow-behind lawn sweepers
Wheels lack traction, especially in wet conditions

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: You *can* pick up leaves with this when you have a perfectly flat yard (no dips or roots) and you take the time to meticulously adjust it just right, but if it works as advertised (which is not often due to the sensitivity to the terrain), the leaf catcher fills up in about 10-15 seconds, literally. After several attempts to make this work (and I really wanted it to work), I decided to get a mulching mower blade and use the lawn mower to grind and blow the leaves to one edge of the yard. Way more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby Checkers

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea that falls short on performance
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to assemble: vague terms inside, up, out don’t help when looking at a piece. Sketches are poor, zoomed in too far to tell how it goes together. Alphabet labels for parts is great but then not used in the sketch. I have a mechanical background and still not sure if the reason it doesn’t work is because it’s put together wrong. Setting sweeping level is impossible. If set too high it doesn’t sweep anything, too low and the wheels lock up and it can’t be pushed. If it is tipped up or down it can lock up or not sweep. If your yard is uneven it will lock up or not pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Harris

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Picks up nearly nothing. After adjusting and adjusting this thing is worthless. If you have St Augustine grass or Floratam don’t was waste your money, I fact, don’t purchase period. I was hoping it would at least sweep my driveway and side walk...NOT! Wondering what the people do to make it work that posted good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: NCM

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it said it was good on pine needles, and I have 3 big trees in my yard. After finding extra parts in my toolbox to replace the missing ones (about two hours of assembly), I finally got it outside. The pine needles wrapped around the spokes and jammed the wheels after just a few seconds. I'm going to toss it in the garbage and go back to raking. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: John Enos

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I’ve been on the fence for months and finally purchased it. I have big leaves, small leaves, pine needles, acorns, pinecones, sticks, hickory nuts, you get the picture. This machine picks up EVERYTHING. You’ll have to play with the settings and the lower you go the harder it is the push. I was wiped when I was done sweeping my lawn but it beats raking for hours. Only reason I gave 4 stars is I think the push bar could be sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I have a push mower because I'm old school. It's too small to have a carrier on it, so I use this to vacuum my lawn. It does the job! It's wider than my mower, so I can make fewer passes. Please note that the level at which you raise or lower the brush will make all the difference in the ease of pushing it. When my neighbors noted it looked more difficult than mowing the lawn, I made the adjustment, and it's been thumbs-up ever since. It picks up grass, leaves, other brush, and miscellaneous debris with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Pavlica

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this in my life. This item was missing two things. I called, they sent me an entire new item, with a return label. This item works flawlessly, picks up leaves with ease. I really needed this in my life. I hated I waited this long to purchase this item. You may have to make a couple of passes, but it's better then bending over and raking leaves. This item works out great for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason GUNN

customer_reviews.title: A great new way to clear the lawn
customer_reviews.text: I just put this together today and gave it a trial run. I'll agree with other reviews that recommend cutting the grass short first. It'll save effort and pick up more. The height is adjustable. My yard has big acorns. It definitely picked them up, along with leaves and small sticks and branches. This should save a lot of effort once the leaves really start to fall. As for acorns, it seems to require rolling over them a few times but definitely easier than kneeling on the ground to scoop them up. Also, the wheels ratchet so the the rakes only work in a forward motion, which I also like.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Ok if ground is completely flat
customer_reviews.text: Does an good job of gathering leaves IF your lawn is totally flat and there are no uneven areas (like tree roots or ground anomalies). It is also is easy to push ONLY if the ground is flat, no moisture or frost/light snow on the ground or leaves. If any of these exist, then it’s a nightmare and is almost impossible to push let alone gather leaves even with adjusting the sweeper. Finally, the instructions were ok, but could’ve been written better. There were a few points where the instructions could be interpreted different ways, thus leading to confusion.
customer_reviews.author: RHE7021

customer_reviews.title: Quality device, light & strong, USA
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials. Hardened bolts, unlock nuts. Nothing extra fancy just high value. I over worked it, 1st time out. Used on crushed rock landscaping which is impregnated with tiny leaves under honey locust tree. Hard work but better than rake & blower. Small irregularities in rock layer stall it due to design for clippings on lawn, so easy height adjustment is appreciated. Picked up some rocks 1.5 to 2 inch dia, wood sticks, leaf litter. Nice. Easy to dump by forward flip. It is wide.
customer_reviews.author: JimAtLarge

customer_reviews.title: You'll get your cardio in!
customer_reviews.text: This DOES work well for picking up leaves, 90% cleaned on first pass IF 1) the leaves are not too thick, 2) the grass is not too high, 3) you are able to summon the strength of the gods from Mount Olympus to push it. Actually, the device is not hard to push if the grass is not high, there is a disconnect from the mechanism when you pull it back (that works 50% of the time, otherwise you are dragging it backwards with the wheels LOCKED). I did not take any photos... I think that the very medium high grass really lugs it down. Still, all in all, it did pick up the leaves admirably.
customer_reviews.author: C.Q. Young

customer_reviews.title: I think that it is overpriced even if I was happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to push through grass even when the grass is short. It picks up stuff fairly well, but it's just too difficult to use so it's on Craigslist waiting for some other sucker to buy it at a fraction of what I paid for it. I think that it is overpriced even if I was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A.M. Murray

customer_reviews.title: It works - and makes you work, too.
customer_reviews.text: I started using a manual reel mower on my lawn and found that attaching the grass catcher made mowing difficult - the grass catcher bag would disconnect on my uneven lawn. This lawn sweeper is harder to push than the mower, and is quite difficult to use on those places where I have ruts in the yard. I'm still learning that I can adjust the height of the "brooms" to match the surface irregularities. On the level regions, it works well. "Sweeping" the lawn is more of an upper-body workout than mowing, however. I really enjoy yard care without the noise and smell of burning gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced... not that useful
customer_reviews.text: While this sweeper was easy to assemble and arrived on time, I would not purchase it again. Certainly not for $126.00. This is lightweight, light duty, light construction, hard to push, low storage capacity, and prone to pre-mature wearing out. The bag is a joke... you can do better with a hand-built tarp! It fills up too quickly because the leaves do not mulch before they get into the bag.. If you can find another one like this for under $90 get it... but other brands for under $90 are just as useful. Especially get a larger push model with greater storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E S

customer_reviews.title: Awkward bagging.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Observations after a few uses: 1. Works best on very dry lawn and dry leaves that have not fall too far into the grass. 2. the bag has alread separates at a seam. 3. Leaves are difficult to empty from the bag unless your turn it upside down. Consequently, it’s a challenge to empty it into paper landscape debris bags and some trash containers. You have to work at it. Best bet is to just dump it over into a large tarp. 3. Do not put the setting too low in an effort to get leaves.l lower in the grass line. The brushes will pull up or break some weaker or newer grass.
customer_reviews.author: CPTAB

customer_reviews.title: Works, but you will have to put in some work
customer_reviews.text: Waited several months (a few seasons' worth of pickups) to write this review. I have used for picking up leaves, pine straw and acorns. Pine straw was the greatest success. Leaves are so much larger and therefore the bag has to be emptied more frequently, which is a little clunky. Make no mistake, you will have to put in some sweat to use this and the amount of effort does rival raking. It will save your arms, however, and I find pushing a little easier. Best results are from pulling back/pushing forward on highly concentrated areas rather than walking through like a lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why did i wait!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, not too heavy for my wife to pick-up and move. While you still need to own a broom and a spring rake, it works very well on grass, a sport court, and even when set a bit higher or a rock driveway. The catch basket is easy one/off. The palnuts came off right away from the upper basket rod but I picked up extra rubber end knobs at the local hardware store and there is no problem now. Like the way it hangs flat against the shed wall for minimal foot print.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED in this product. The bolts are too long, so all items are loose and do not tighten all the way. The hole on the right handle where a bolt should go was not molded correctly so the bolt wouldn't go through - we had to zip-tie the pieces together. Both of the brush blades fell off at one point during the first 5 minutes of use. Our yard is covered in leaves so I have no idea where the lost bolt and nut actually are in the yard. After less than 30 minutes of use, the edge on the red bag is fraying too. Definitely going to try and return to get our money back!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Million dollar idea
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than raking, my entire street block is now using one. Definitely worth it! My only beef is that it isn't holding up that well in terms of parts breaking. There's a cheap little plastic part on bottom under bag that broke almost immediately. Still works but it's annoying. Also, it's a little cumbersome to empty. I would imagine an elderly person having difficulty with dumping it. Still, it's saved me this Fall, and I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Bedivere Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works well on very level lawns
customer_reviews.text: This would work better if our lawn was a lot flatter. With the giant leaves from our London plane trees there are a whole lot of trips to empty the bin, and the endless supply of cottonwood twigs just wrap around the axle and stop progress. It's nice for a change from the raking motion, but it still takes about as much effort as a reel mower to push and turn (and turn and turn). At the end of the day in my own yard, I'm more efficient raking leaves onto an old shower curtain and then gathering up the corners to toss them into the yard waste bin.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Works good on dry leaves
customer_reviews.text: In putting it together, the only thing I had difficulty with were the palnuts. I used it yesterday and it worked pretty well. We did have snow and some of the leaves were still wet, those were difficult to pick up. However with the dry leaves, it worked like a charm. Even had someone driving by stop and ask where I got it. I will be using it more this weekend and for many weeks to come.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a very short period of time. Great concept but the metal rusted VERY fast and it was useless after less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Silke

customer_reviews.title: No more leaves
customer_reviews.text: Only a 26" pickup but if you don't mind walking a few extra passes it works just fine. We got most of the leaves up the night before it rained. Then after the wind and rain the leaves were not so thick but they were wet and it picked most of them up. Our lawn is not completely flat it has some humps from tree roots. It will pick up the leaves on top but not down in the divots. I am guessing the more expensive models do a better job but if you don't want to invest that much money and don't mind picking up a few stragglers this will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: pie

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: So I have a large amount of artifical turf to clean with multiple trees and make picking up the leaves a rentless job, I was using a shop vac which took so long. i have been buying multiple types of vaccum type equipment but no such luck. Then I seen this I did have to modify it a bit by putting a 4 inch strip of rubber in the front so it will stop kicking out stuff I'm trying to sweep up but after that it now works very well. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: J. Stefani

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing and didn't even know they existed. I use this to sweep up leaves off of a moss garden and it works great, its a bit noisy but works well. Tighten the nuts and bolts really well when you assemble this otherwise they will come off when using it and you will have to go back and find them on the ground later, I am really bad about that and learned my lesson when assembling this.

customer_reviews.title: Just got this for acorns
customer_reviews.text: We have a ton of acorns. They decorate my patio daily in the fall. I bought this recently and have yet to use it in the grass because of all of the rain. On the concrete patio, it picks up leaves well. About 50% of the acorns get picked up and the rest become projectiles. The bag design could be improved so that more of the acorns end up there and not ricocheting out. It's a little bit of a learning curve to use. You have to lift the handle as you push or the brushes don't turn. The faster you go the better it works.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Said

customer_reviews.title: So much quieter than blowers and faster than raking!
customer_reviews.text: We can't stand the noise and smell of gas-powered leaf blowers. We have a lot of large trees on our property that drop a vast quantity of leaves, so lawn services cost a fortune. Our backs and shoulders can't take the hours of raking any more. The Lawn Sweeper is effective, and actually fun to use. It's height can be adjusted easily. Front lawn leaves dumped easily to the curb for pick up; back yard leaves dumped in our compost pile -- just tilt forward, no need to detach the bag. Added advantage of a bit of fresh air and aerobic exercise without the noise and air pollution, and lots faster than raking.
customer_reviews.author: Book Gifter

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly, Good Performance
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a breeze. I don't know why others had difficulty, perhaps the design has been updated. It took me less than 10 min to assemble. Operation is acceptable and better with practice. Setting the sweeping height is key for smooth or bucking operation. I used to clean up gum balls and on each pass it would pick up 70-80%, kicking a few ahead. This is still way better than raking or picking up by hand. I would recommend this sweeper.
customer_reviews.author: Bumhip

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is kind of ridiculous. It doesn’t work unless you’re holding it kind of high up off the ground. Like a wheel barrel. And it constantly slams to a stop because it gets stuck on sticks and rocks. Who doesn’t have twigs and rocks?! And if you have thick grass good luck. I was using it on dirt to get leaves and it was a nightmare lol. Great concept, but with it being manual it makes you work harder than you would with just a good ole rake.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan

customer_reviews.title: needed some tweaking but great overall
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pick up pine straw and pine cones. It does both and also little sticks. had a problem with the brushes throwing cones out of the front end but I put a piece of hard plastic across the bottom and seems to have remedied the problem. The push bars were a little flimsy but when I put it together I used a piece of pvc conduit to reinforce the joints and so far no problems very solid now.
customer_reviews.author: CHad

customer_reviews.title: Good for light leaves and other yard waste
customer_reviews.text: I originally go it for leaves, as I live in the woods and have a small yard. But I found it extremely useful in picking up the hickory nuts and husks that litter the yard. Before I got it, I could literally use a shovel to pick up the waste but this would sometime damage the yard. Once I had the brush height set properly, I was cleaning huge paths of nuts off the ground. I had to experiment with the height for my grass height but I love the work it has eliminate for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: In order to pick up anything, land needs to be somewhat level and grass pretty short. Small branches get hung and acorns tend to get skipped over unless you are on pavement. Part of the metal axle rusted even without direct contact with water. Bag may need replacing next year. It cuts down on leaves but not enough to justify having it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha T

customer_reviews.title: Leaf Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this product. It actually works better than I expected. It's impractical to use for a lawn that's covered in leaves because you'd be emptying it constantly. However for sporadic leaves it really works well. It works best when the grass is short but the height adjustment feature makes it functional even in long grass. Good Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed to have to tear it apart due the main tight
customer_reviews.text: When received this and put it together as per the instructions and the brushes moved the wrong way. We called support 3 times one said the wheelers needed to be changed: this did not work finally we were told that unfortunately that it was put together At the company backwards- this was s huge ordeal but we did get it turned around hope it will work like it is sussose to . So not even sure it will work great’ They should have sent us antiher one that was factory correct’ to save us much time and frustration to use it and see it does only ok. Dissappointed
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Steffans

customer_reviews.title: Solved my Pine Needle Problem
customer_reviews.text: The Agri-Fab 26 inch lawn sweeper was very easy to assemble. About half an hour to get it ready to sweep the lawn. I have artificial turf with several pine trees which is a bad mix on windy days. This Lawn sweeper did an excellent job of sweeping up the pine needles. My pine needle problem is solved.
customer_reviews.author: RogerR2

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to push in grass, takes more effort than just using a rake.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with this sweeper. Even at the highest setting, it's extremely difficult to push across the grass. If you hold it at EXACTLY the right angle, you can usually get it to work. But forget sending the kids out to pick up grass. They can't get it to budge. It's much less effort to just rake than use this. I wish I'd gone another route and maybe paid extra for a pull-behind model. For me the packaging and assembly wasn't a real problem like other reviewers have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: David Resseguie

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Once set the the height to a reasonable level it does a good job. It does a pretty good job of picking up leaves and stuff ON TOP of the grass. Dont expect it to dig in and pick up lease in between the grass though. I also use it to pick up acorns and dirt on my concrete patio. It's picks up MOST of the stuff like Acorns, leaves, trash etc. but it leaves some as well. For the most part it does like 70% of the job.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Huerta

customer_reviews.title: A very good product, but for gum ball sweeping, I'd call it average.
customer_reviews.text: A good product. I want to give it 5 stars, but it has a little trouble with gum balls. My nemesis! It does sweep them up, but it takes quite a few passes to get about 75% to 80% of them. Which is still good, it cuts raking time way down. Which is why I'm torn about giving it 5 stars. It does work well and it does a really good job sweeping up everything else. It's just that the one thing I really need it to do well is sweep gum balls, which it seems only average at doing. A solid product overall.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to work
customer_reviews.text: The unit works best in low cut grass. High cut St Augustine is virtually useless. Even in low cut grass be prepared to push hard. As the bin fills up it gets heavier and more difficult to push. You still have to bend over to move the leaves into a large leaf bag. I could do about 4 large bags in an hour of heavy leaf fall. I usually bag about 26 bags of deep leaves. It is a time saver for me over 6’ and 240 lbs. if you have low grass and less density it is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: A Handy Yard Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little yard tool for sweeping up leaves in early and late fall when leaves have just started to fall or are at the final stages of falling. If you have a heavily wooded property this sweeper might get a little overwhelmed during the peak time when leaves are falling and would require frequent dumping, although maybe better than raking.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I have a bad shoulder and cannot rake. It took a minute to get the feel for it but it worked great for my purpose. If you are a meticulous perfectionist, this isn't for you. It doesn't get 100% of the leaves but it gets the majority. I gave it four stars because the bag could be made better. I put duct tape on all seems and the elastic stitching before I used it. I could that ripping easily.
customer_reviews.author: dnovacek

customer_reviews.title: I dont recommend this if you are seriously try to pick up leaves
customer_reviews.text: I retured this after my first use You can to go over a spot with leaves a dozen timesbefor you notice that it works . It was way to time consuming for the size yard I was using it for it was faster to just rack the yard
customer_reviews.author: STARR

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect But Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: It does a pretty good job. Not perfect, but gets most leaves. It is a bit tricky... must have the height adjustment set just right and then the angle just right when pushing. If not, you miss picking up leaves or you feel like you are trying to push a 747 airplane. Still better/easier/quicker than raking or blowing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Better than all the raking
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once so far but I am happy. My yard is uneven, so I do have to raise and lower the height. I’d recommend wearing a dust mask since it throws the yard debris toward you. If you don’t lift it high enough, it will kick some debris forward. Knowing this from another review helped me adjust how I hold it. There is resistance on dense grass. My husband didn’t have any trouble building it for me (even the pal nuts others struggled with). I have a very large yard and I am happy to eliminate the extensive raking I usually do. I tried grass and leaves. It works for both, just adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installing palnuts and leaves too light.
customer_reviews.text: When installing the palnuts put the rod vertical on a hard surface, put a palnut on the rod (watch your fingers, use a needle nose to hold the palnut) tap it with a hammer. The brushes are directional, I had to remove them and install and align the brushes proper (my fault). My leaves are small and light, many fly out under the cover. adjusting the height and keeping the skids off the ground makes it easier to push. My turf is synthetic. Light leaves expel a lot, heavier leaves go into the catcher more often. It takes time to get it set right. 2/3 of the leaves go into the catcher, the rest goes out below the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Saves tons of time
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this with all the negative reviews. I’m glad I bought it. I have 6 large firs in my yard and the drop branches, needles, and pine cones everywhere. This thing saves lots of time from raking and does a pretty good job picking up most of the debris. The only complaint I have is that I have to adjust the height a lot due to uneven ground, but I guess thats kind of my problem not the products. Once you get the height perfect this thing does a really good job. Make sure you dont have really long grass or this thing can be really difficult to push.
customer_reviews.author: jhle

customer_reviews.title: Great but cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but does the job. If there was a pro model with better components and a bigger leaf catcher I would pay $500 or more. It has so much potential but can be annoying because of the small collection bag. It’s so much better than taking or using a leaf blower. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because almost everything is cheap plastic and the collection bag is too small. I definitely recommend, just be aware of those things!
customer_reviews.author: EdgeHappens

customer_reviews.title: WORTH BUYING
customer_reviews.text: Brushes tube end will cut your hands-WATCH OUT!.. No mention of Red-Blue marks in manual, had to see video first (I think video is backwards from what is described). Assembled rather easy. Used it for pine needles, it works fine except for needles directly on the dirt at thin lawn spots, of course. Quality seems durable enough for its purpose. Parts list very clear if you ever need to replace something. I'd rather have a tow-behind but they are 80# (no place to store). Maybe I'll rig this up for a tow-behind? BOTTOM LINE- IT'S WORTH BUYING.
customer_reviews.author: suber

customer_reviews.title: Picks up as designed.
customer_reviews.text: The sweeping action is really smooth and can be easily adjusted. The bag doesn't hold much, so it has to be emptied often. Brushes seem to hold pine needles and any vines get really wrapped. Not a game changer. just accept this regular cleaning as normal maintenance
customer_reviews.author: Mark in NC

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm on our artificial turf!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for sweeping leaves and 1/2 inch seeds off of our artificial turf, and it works like a charm. We had previously tried raking, hand sweeping, blowing and vacuuming and this is the fastest solution, by far. One note is that after setting the sweeper height properly many of the seeds kicked out forward when we pushed, so we added a row of double thick duct tape (stuck back-to-back) to the bottom of the front edge between the wheels. This is stiff enough to contain the items and not get stuck in the brushes. It doesn't quite reach the grass.
customer_reviews.author: NLE

customer_reviews.title: Picks up leaves like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Picks up leaves with ease - Easy to adjust height - Will save a lot of time over raking - Large bag - works well on sidewalks and driveways Cons - Intermediate level assembly - I had to drill a few holes that were not machined correctly - While the brushes and housing seem rugged, the frame and bag do not I'd like to see a model with higher build quality similar to my fiskars reel mower although I still be happy overall if this lasts 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble. Found to be missing two parts and after a quick call to customer service they were in the mail. Arrived on the third day. Goal was to beat the leaves falling so delay was no issue. Did get to try it on the acorns and seemed to pick up a good amount on wet grass. Anything helps as I have millions in my yard. I would recommend this product as it functions well and appears sturdy
customer_reviews.author: haynesd1

customer_reviews.title: A useful tool that assists in yard clean up but not as complete as racking.
customer_reviews.text: Accept it as a tool that assists with yard clean up. Racking does a more complete job. Works very well picking up Douglas fir needles and only O.K. with leaves and fir cones. Requires frequent adjustment in height depending on ground contour and grass length. Overall, still use this to assist in a quick, imperfect yard clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Quality product with easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This particular lawn sweeper was chosen due to the fact that 26" beats 42" for storage. The assembly instructions were very good. Assembly itself went smoothly without a hitch. In actual use, the sweeper did a great job. Height was very easy to adjust. There is nothing to add to this machine except the availability of a front mounted assembly to pull with a tractor. I do not know of any company that makes a push or pull sweeper. This one would be ideal for that addition.
customer_reviews.author: Roger W.

customer_reviews.title: its a manual brush that rotates to pick up grass, leaves, and other left overs
customer_reviews.text: if your yard has a lot of leaves, this is not for you. The bag will fill up too quickly. I use this to push around left over leaves once a week, the height is adjustable but if you have un level ground it maybe annoying to adjust height per the area or you'll have to push harder due to the resistence. I love it since it does its job and gets me out of the house to exercise. its a fun toy for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. T.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and easy to assemble. The problem is that if you back yard isn’t perfectly level it doesn’t work. I thought my yard for level but while using this item I noticed little dips in the yard. Where my yard was level this item worked great
customer_reviews.author: BZMama

customer_reviews.title: Better than raking
customer_reviews.text: Works great especially if you like to get your steps in for the day it's like the old-time vacuum cleaner but it's made for the outdoors. You just have to remember to raise the handle up to keep the bottom from dragging on the grass this makes it much easier to push.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Johns

customer_reviews.title: THIS WOULD MAKE THE POPE CUSE
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Putting this beast together is enough to make the Pope cuse! I've never been so mad or cursed so much in my life time. I'm not a person that throws tantrums or fits but let me tell ya, tools were flying everywhere. First let me say EVERYTHING must be assembled. The company doesn't even put the brushes on... pitiful and then there were missing parts! Plan on at least an hour if you have to deal with all this.
customer_reviews.author: Weego

customer_reviews.title: Timesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I got this last week and have already done my backyard twice which would normally have taken two or more hours raking each time. It took about 45 mins each time. Just set it to your length of grass and go. That's it. Hopefully it is sturdy. May buy one for my wife to help with.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bogda

customer_reviews.title: Great for all-moss lawns.
customer_reviews.text: A bit gnarly to assemble, and two small parts enclosed were defective. Customer service was swift and pleasant and arranged prompt replacement. The unit is very lightweight and therefore a bit flimsy compared to the all-metal versions I used years ago. But it does the job. Easy to use and easy to empty the leaf bin. Works particularly well on our all-moss lawn. As we live in a forest, we get lots of leaves. Far superior to noisy blowers.
customer_reviews.author: Houndduet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Picks up pine needles!
customer_reviews.text: I have artificial grass in my backyard with two huge pine trees. So my grass is always full of pine needles. I read the reviews and I bought it hoping it would pick up the pine needles. IT PICKS UP THE FRICKIN PINE NEEDLESS!!! I am so happy with this machine. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Works great for grass clippings
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I bought it for to pick up grass clumps after mowing. Makes the yard look clean. I have approx 1/2 acre of lawn and it takes less than 20 minutes to sweep. I only wanted to remove clippings that lay on top of the grass. Does not take the place of a grass bagger.
customer_reviews.author: PVT

customer_reviews.title: Still a manual device
customer_reviews.text: The sweeper does do what it is intended to do. Picks up leaves, acorns and small sticks. Best to have the grass cut short to reduce friction. The physical 'work' of picking up leaves and gathering them into the catcher is still done by muscle power. Can be a little tiring.
customer_reviews.author: John Rosenfelder

customer_reviews.title: If it wasn’t so big I would return it
customer_reviews.text: I have acorns EVERYWHERE so I really wanted to love this but my backyard is on a slant and this just isn’t picking the acorns up. It does so-so with leaves if I blow them into a pile.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lassiter

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Furious
customer_reviews.text: I found assembly to be difficult but doable. Once assembled and height adjusted I was able to sweep yard rather effortlessly. The hopper fills quickly but easy to dump. Doesn’t get close to fence but either blow or rake into yard and there ya go. Much faster and easier than raking.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Makes Yard Cleanup So Much Easier!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get some exercise in the yard while cleaning up the cut grass clippings as well as leaves. Easy to push. After capture of leaves, clippings (or hay like our dry yard...) just need to put in a bag - makes it a lot easier (and no raking - or at least it won’t be much). Happy with this purchase so far (just got).
customer_reviews.author: KMtuck

customer_reviews.title: Shipped promptly in reliable packaging; assembled well, works well.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered with some trepidation, given earlier reviews about missing parts or poor packaging. The good news is that the packaging issues have apparently been solved (or perhaps were originally not so common) by either stronger cartons, faster shipping (Prime) or both. And indeed there were no assembly problems. As for the operation, so far I am satisfied. As you might imagine, it works better on long expanses of level ground(which we have) better than rough or more rolling terrain.(which we also have.)
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Gaul

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Sweeper arrived with all parts included. I had to go buy wrenches I did not have on hand. Sweeper was fairly easy to assemble; however, the company could have assembled more of it. Lose the palnuts. They were the worst part of the assembly.The reviews are correct in that an uneven ground will be more difficult. It picks up well, even pine cones. Do not let the bag drag the ground. Time will tell how well it and the cheaply-made collection bag will last.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: I have a fairly small lawn which made trying to use a rider to sweep the leaves so I purchased the Agri-Fab. Assembly was a bit confusing, but once I figured it out there were no problems. This unit works very and does a great job of sweeping leaves, but know from the start it is hard work. My only complaint is it is very difficult to dump the leaves from the sweeper into bags, no matter how large the bag. If one is simply dumpling the leaves into a pile, no problem, but getting them into a bag is difficult. The bottom line is if one does not mind getting a bit of exercise this the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Sweeps up wet leaves too
customer_reviews.text: I love this sweeper! It actually picks up wet leaves. Honestly it has also swept up gravel and dog poo from an unknown source. I use this with a leaf vacuum/mulcher and the process is so easy and fast. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Small yards only
customer_reviews.text: Does an excellent job picking up sticks, leaves(even sopping wet leaves), and pine needles. Definitely for small yards. They didn’t send the right rods for holding bag but I had something that worked so 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: j.seaman

customer_reviews.title: totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the leaf/ lawn sweeper just in time for the leaves, as they are surely coming down now. Seeing that I was by myself, assembly was difficult. There is a youtube video that shows in detail 2 persons putting it together. The product is sturdy and does what it is supposed to do. I am happy that I made this purchase now.
customer_reviews.author: bedford f brown

customer_reviews.title: This sweeper is good. It collects leaves quite well on flat even ...
customer_reviews.text: This sweeper is good. It collects leaves quite well on flat even lawns but not so well on uneven grounds. Raking is still needed but the sweeper makes it much easier because it collects large amounts of leaves quickly. The bag is small and needs dumping constantly when there is a ton of leaves. I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ_Philly

customer_reviews.title: Works well on flat ground with dry leaves
customer_reviews.text: Works great and picked up dry leaves just fine. Had to fiddle a bit with the height setting. Too high and it wouldn't pick up well. Too low and the brushes would dig deep into the grass making it really hard to push. Need to walk with a quick pace to keep the brushes whirring fast enough. The kids actually thought it was fun to push around. Of course we were also using it to make them a leaf pile for jumping. Didn't take long to put together with basic tools.Haven't tried with wet leaves but I wouldn't have great expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Blouch

customer_reviews.title: Plastic breaks on install
customer_reviews.text: Product itself looks okay. While installing had the plastic break on me while hand tightening it. Not the end of the world but not what I'd expect brand new from the box. Will edit based on how it performs
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Adjust height to terrain frequently
customer_reviews.text: Works best on even lawn or terrain. It’s sweeps the lawn well minus the small acorns stuck in the small ditches of lawn. You have to adjust the height each time. If there was a way it would drop down automatically to reach lower dips would be fantastic. Otherwise it picks up leaves and dead grass and debris quite well.
customer_reviews.author: JRV81

customer_reviews.title: agri-fab push lawn sweeper
customer_reviews.text: LIKE...Have yet to use on grass.........but assembly is a real treat........going to contact seller for parts missing in assembly package.............seems some parts could be made of stronger material............questioning if bag will hold up. Will update review after using for the first time. Thanks for the people that answered all my original questions.
customer_reviews.author: D. BAX

customer_reviews.title: Gasoline free
customer_reviews.text: Looking for something easier than a rake to pick up leaves. This is very fast. A couple of things to note: 1. You will need to adjust the height (sometimes frequently), depending on the height and density of the grass. 2. When tipping backwards to empty the bin, some leaves always get stuck in the rake portion, so it doesn't empty completely. Get the green plastic "mitts" that they up-sell with this sweeper. They work very well, in general, and are the perfect size to empty the bin on the last stretch. Next is to see if this will pick up all the maple seeds next spring.... I'll keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Useful sweeper. Assembly okay.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Assembly was pretty straight forward but, instructions on how to attach palnut was lacking. I ended up tearing the tarp material while figuring it out. Tip - - use a small socket to hold palnut in place, stand rod on its end, and gently hammer the socket holding the palnut. Sweeper seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this less than 30 days and have picked up leaves and thatch on 3 different lawns. Its so much faster than raking. The important part is making sure the height is set perfect. I may have to make a second pass but it definitely much easier to push using your legs, than raking and twisting your core. Thank you for saving my back!
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Great leaf picker upper
customer_reviews.text: Made getting believes that fell after our professional yard clean up off the lawn and into the yard bags for our garbage pick up. Highly recommend for those of you who do not like or cannot use a traditional Rake
customer_reviews.author: Denise Regan

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVES this.
customer_reviews.text: It works so well that my husband actually enjoys going out and running it over the lawn to pick up leaves - and we have a 1/3 acre yard! I bought him a Bag Butler along with it, and it's the perfect combination. If you buy one of these, you should also invest in a Bag Butler as well.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I occasional have small amounts of grass cuttings to pick up and this sweeper is perfect.. The power mower I used to bag ground up leaves finally died,, after 30n years, and this sweeper replaces it. I grind up the leaves with my lawn tractor and reduce them to small iles for compost. This hand sweeper is perfect for picking up those ground up leaf piles. . .
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: It Works, Just doesn't hold as much as I had hoped!
customer_reviews.text: Good, basic, piece of yard equipment. The hopper is smaller and hold less that I had hoped for. Makes for very frequent dumps. It works. I would recommend it for small yards with one or two trees.
customer_reviews.author: Don F.

customer_reviews.title: Like everyone says - the bag is small
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone says - the bag is small. However I am using this on 5 acres for the various trees scattered throughout the property. I don't try to get all of the leaves up - just the piles so that they won't kill the grass. It does this very well and even on the highest setting, it still picks up small sticks. The property is very hilly so as others suggested, I do get my steps in and daily exercise.
customer_reviews.author: psm

customer_reviews.title: Pushing takes some effort!
customer_reviews.text: This does an OK job of picking up yard debris, but only somewhat satisfactory with pine needs, which was the main reason we purchased this. It is a bear to push, however. Holding the handle at just the right angle is important, but even then it takes quite a bit of effort to move it along.
customer_reviews.author: jmm1023

customer_reviews.title: Not for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but pretty flimsy for the price. I'm using this on a smaller pad of artificial turf, but realize it's really geared for larger patches. It doesn't manuever well around corners or inset stones. Seems like it would be good for larger flat areas.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Small yards with few leaves
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay but has several downsides. It pushes the leaves back over the sides and out of the top. It should have higher side walls or a better mounting area for the bag. If you have a small yard with very few leaves it would be idea for basic leaf maintenance. I will be sending mine back though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Turk

customer_reviews.title: You might have to go over area more than once but definitely beats binding over and over and over again pick crap out of the yard
customer_reviews.text: This picks up everything! Sticks, gum balls, pine cones, pine needles, leaves, mulch that has come out of my beds. You might have to go over area more than once but definitely beats binding over and over and over again pick crap out of the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Windle

customer_reviews.title: Nice sweeper for artificial turf.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when I first got this sweeper since I had tried powered vacuums with little luck. To my amazement this sweeper did the job quite well on my artificial turf and all without power or cords. It picked up almost all of the mesquite tree droppings and brush leaves. The only part it couldn't get was the edges near the patio and walkway, but not a huge deal since this was easily cleaned up with the leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: jmt

customer_reviews.title: It works with modifications
customer_reviews.text: It works. The thing I disliked about this sweeper is that the top and bottom metal rod would always pop off and had to hold the top rod in place with my other hand while sweeping my lawn to prevent that. What I had to do was to buy 2 longer metal square rods. I drilled a hole for thr bottom one and now it fits securely and the top one I just matched the thickness of the plastic clips. Works like a champ now. This is overpriced, it should be no more then 50 dollars. I'm sure there are better lawn sweepers out there
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Has been great so far picks up leaves and twigs from grass easily. Picking up leaves froms bare ground a little more difficult but does pick up. I did put tape on front of unit to keep the leaves from flying out infront. ( thanks to how to with doc review)
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long ?
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing scince sliced bread . I have 8 inch pine needles , and it works perfect . However , if you let needles build up to thick on the ground , it will tend to load up the sweeper .
customer_reviews.author: Hoody

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile investment
customer_reviews.text: Living in a new house with LOTS of trees and bought this to see if it would make ‘raking’ easier. It did. The bag fills up somewhat quickly, but it’s compatible to raking up a pile...and isn’t necessarily a flaw of the product, just the fact that I have a LOT of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Probably works better on grass. Sucks in our zero-scaped yard. can't go low enough to get the pine needles and small leaves without a bunch of dirt. Can't do decent piles. Waste of my time..
customer_reviews.author: Lizy L

customer_reviews.title: Made modifications...works great, Now!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I made a slight modification to the front. I added a flexible 2 inch shield. By adding this, it allows me to pickup leaves and pine straw on low surfaces like driveway or Bermuda grass that is cut short.
customer_reviews.author: chikiBABY

customer_reviews.title: Not great, a challenge
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work great on uneven surfaces. Will not pick up well on cement sidewalks , it flings, rather than sweep into basket. I'm being honest, I thought it would be a better product.
customer_reviews.author: David and Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Better than most Lawn Sweepers
customer_reviews.text: Pro- Compact for storage. Easy to setup and get going. Adjustments easy to do. Con- Does not completely pick up parachute seeds from Maple trees, for which I bought it for. But is still better than others I think.
customer_reviews.author: vulcan

customer_reviews.title: A well made tool that gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very early in the leaf raking season but this already has proven to be a smart purchase. Good quality and assembly was relatively easy. It’s light but has a satisfying feel to it. The brush-wheel gearing is just right and gives a very satisfying tactile feedback, much like a push mower of olden days. Getting the height adjustment is very important but it’s very easily set. It CAN be an excellent cardio session if you set it low (which is not necessary for leaf pickup.) We’re using it every morning and staying ahead of the chore!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Boer

customer_reviews.title: Easily beats raking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pick up grass clippings. Neighborhood kid mulches when he mowes my yard but sometimes if it’s too long I’ll get rows of dead grass. I hate raking and I have a fairly large yard. I was hoping this would work and it did. Pros: Picked up rows of dead grass very well. Relatively easy to put together and I’m terrible at that. Easy to drag backwards when just moving it somewhere when not picking up stuff. Cons: Harder to push than I expected but that’s probably why it works.
customer_reviews.author: Miknan

product_meta.title: Agri-Fab 45-0218 26-Inch Push Lawn Sweeper, 26 Inches, Black
product_meta.description:
The Agri-Fab, 26” Push Lawn Sweeper Model #45-0218 will help you maintain the professionally-groomed lawn that you deserve. Why spend hours doing the back-breaking work required to clean up debris in your yard? An Agri-Fab lawn sweeper will make your life easier because of its exceptional performance. Whether you are cleaning up grass clippings in the spring and summer, or cleaning up leaves and small twigs in the fall, using an Agri-Fab Sweeper will make it easier. The 26” Push Lawn Sweeper’s two poly tires ensure a smooth transport on the working area. Four brushes sweep debris into a hopper bag, which is capable of holding 12 cu. ft. A unique lightweight design allows for easy handling. The 26” Push Lawn Sweeper can be stored easily, saving valuable space. The Agri-Fab 26” Push Lawn Sweeper Model #45-0218 will last you for years to come with proper care and use. All Agri-Fab, products come with a 3-year limited .

AMAZON.COM
The leaf and lawn sweeper is a fun device that speeds up yard work and cuts down on the monotony of raking. It won't be of much use once the leaves have gotten wet and matted down, but it's a tremendous help when you're trying to keep up with those midautumn leaves that seem to come down by the bucketful. Agri-Fab's model is lightweight and has a fully adjustable sweeper level. The polypropylene housing and zinc-plated steel frame are designed to last. The replaceable vinyl bag has a capacity of about 7 cubic feet.
feature_bullets: Hopper bag: 7 cu. Ft. Capacity; collapsible hopper bag for easy storage
Assembly: some assembly required; a video instruction Guide is available to assist with the assembly process
Brush: wheel ratio: 4. 5 to 1 Brush to wheel ratio
Height adjustment: easy to use brush height adjustment
Push lawn sweeper with adjustable height settings
Easy way to pick up lawn clippings and leaves off lawn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,100 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
